signal.name: MmPropertiesChanged
signal.tp:docstring: One or more properties' values changed.

arg.name: interface
arg.tp:docstring: The D-Bus interface of the changed properties.

arg.name: properties
arg.tp:docstring: The changed property names and their new values.

method.name: Enable
method.tp:docstring: Enable the device. Initializes the modem.

arg.name: enable
arg.tp:docstring: True to enable the device, False to disable.

arg.name: number
arg.tp:docstring: The number to use for dialing.

method.name: GetIP4Config
method.tp:docstring: Request the IP4 configuration from the device. Note that it'll only be supported for IPMethod MM_MODEM_IP_METHOD_STATIC.
method.arg: Structure containing IP4 address, DNS1, DNS2, DNS3. The DNS list is padded with 0's if there's less than 3 DNS servers.

method.name: GetInfo
method.tp:docstring: Get the card information (manufacturer, modem, version).

arg.name: info
arg.tp:docstring: Structure containing manufacturer, model, and version (revision) of the card.

method.name: FactoryReset
method.tp:docstring: Reset the modem to as close to factory state as possible.
method.arg: Carrier-supplied code required to reset the modem. Ignored if not required.

property.name: Device
property.tp:docstring: The modem port to use for IP configuration and traffic.

property.name: MasterDevice
property.tp:docstring: The physical modem device reference (ie, USB, PCI, PCMCIA device), which may be dependent upon the operating system. In Linux for example, this points to a sysfs path of the usb_device object.

property.name: Enabled
property.tp:docstring: TRUE if the modem is enabled (ie, powered and usable), FALSE if it is disabled.

property.name: EquipmentIdentifier
property.tp:docstring: The identity of the device. This will be the IMEI number for GSM devices and the hex-format ESN/MEID for CDMA devices.

property.name: UnlockRequired
property.tp:docstring: Empty if the device is usable without an unlock code or has already been unlocked. If the device needs to be unlocked before becoming usable this property contains the specific unlock code required. Â Valid unlock code values are "" (blank), "sim-pin", "sim-puk", "ph-sim-pin", "ph-fsim-pin", "ph-fsim-puk", "sim-pin2", "sim-puk2", "ph-net-pin", "ph-net-puk", "ph-netsub-pin", "ph-netsub-puk", "ph-sp-pin", "ph-sp-puk", "ph-corp-pin", and "ph-corp-puk".

property.name: UnlockRetries
property.tp:docstring: The number of unlock retries remaining for the unlock code given by the property UnlockRequired, or 999 if the device does not support reporting unlock retries.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Use PPP to get the address.
Static configuration, the modem will provide IP information.
